paper_title.en: A Conveninet One Pot Allylation of Aldehydes with Allylic Halides Prepared in situ from Allylic Alcohol in the Presence of Metallic Bismuth
Solvent-mediated chemoselective reduction of aldehydes by using tributyltin hydride in methanol, aqueous organic solvents, or water: An environmentally benign process

description.en: Aldehydes are reduced chemoselectively by using tributyltin hydride in methanol, aqueous organic solvents, or water to provide the corresponding alcohols in high yields. NI, additional catalyst is required. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Solvent-mediated chemoselective reduction of aldehydes by using tributyltin hydride in methanol, aqueous organic solvents, or water: An environmentally benign process

description.en: Aldehydes are reduced chemoselectively by using tributyltin hydride in methanol, aqueous organic solvents, or water to provide the corresponding alcohols in high yields. NI, additional catalyst is required. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: ビスマスやスズ化合物を用いる有機合成ー含水溶媒中や水中での有機合成反応を中心としてー

paper_title.en: A novel aqueous Barbier-Grignard-type allylation of aldehydes in a Mg/BiCl3 bimetal system

description.en: The allylation of aldehydes with allylic bromides proceeded smoothly in a Mg/BiCl3 bimetal system even in THF-H2O to afford the corresponding homoallylic alcohols in good yields. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science Ltd.

paper_title.en: A novel aqueous Barbier-Grignard-type allylation of aldehydes in a Mg/BiCl3 bimetal system

description.en: The allylation of aldehydes with allylic bromides proceeded smoothly in a Mg/BiCl3 bimetal system even in THF-H2O to afford the corresponding homoallylic alcohols in good yields. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science Ltd.

paper_title.ja: Bismuth(Ⅲ) Bromide as an Efficient and Versatile Catalyst for Cyanation and Allylation of Carbonyl Compounds and Acetals with Organosilicone Reagents
paper_title.en: Bismuth bromide as an efficient and versatile catalyst for the cyanation and allylation of carbonyl compounds and acetals with organosilicon reagents

description.en: Bismuth bromide was found to work efficiently as a versatile catalyst for the cyanation and allylation of carbonyl compounds and acetals with organosilicon reagents, affording me corresponding alcohols and ethers in high yields. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science Ltd.

paper_title.en: Bismuth bromide as an efficient and versatile catalyst for the cyanation and allylation of carbonyl compounds and acetals with organosilicon reagents

paper_title.ja: Stereoselective Synthesis of 1,2-Amino Alcohols by Addition of Oeganocuprate・BF<sub>3</sub> Complexes and Organolithium Reagents to an α-Silyloxyaldimine Derived from(s)-Ethyl Lactate
paper_title.en: Stereoselective synthesis of 1,2-amino alcohols by addition of organocuprate center-dot BF3 complexes and organolithium reagents to an alpha-silyloxyaldimine derived from (S)-ethyl lactate

description.en: 1,2-Amino alcohols were synthesized by addition of organocuprate . BF3 2 (R=n-Bu, n-octyl, Me, phenethyl, Ph), organocopper . BF3 3 (R=Me, n-Bu), and organolithiums (R=n-Bu, n-octyl, Me, phenethyl, Ph) to an alpha-silyloxyaldimine 1 derived from commercially available (S)-ethyl lactate. The reactions with organocuprate . BF3 2 and organocopper . BF3 3 led to the anti isomers almost exclusively (anti:syn=>98:<2 for R=n-Bu, n-octyl, Me, phenethyl and anti:syn=95:5 for R=Ph, 52-93% isolated yields) and the syn isomers could be obtained with high stereoselectivities by using organolithiums (anti:syn=10:90-20:80, 41-71% isolated yields). Copyright (C) 1996 Elsevier Science Ltd.
